roleset.name: to hit, with words or a bat (etc)
roleset.note: BASH-V NOTES: Based on WSJ. Member of VerbNet class hit-18.1, bump-18.4-1. (from bash.01-v)
BASHING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, bash-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls bump-18.4-1, hit-18.1, throw-17.1-1. (from bashing.01-n)

example.name: bash-v: transitive
example.text: Finally , the case of Dr. Morgan gave Congress-1 an opportunity to act with unaccustomed decisiveness and to engage in one of its favorite pastimes -- [*-1] bashing the District of Columbia government .

example.name: bashing-n: both args
example.text: In their bashing of PV Narashima Rao, the Congress displays extreme ingratitude.

roleset.name: to hit, completive
roleset.note: BASH_UP-V, BASHING_UP-N NOTES: added by Julia, identical to bash.01.

example.name: bash_up
example.text: If not, it will be chaos if everyone pretends to be drunk and bashes up others.
